definition: prefecture/(old) province/(old) administrative division/state (e.g. of US)/oblast (Russia)/canton (Switzerland)

sentences.english: The new zone sits on the northern end of the cross-sea Hangzhou Bay Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 大桥新区位于杭州湾跨海大桥北堍。

sentences.english: China's Hangzhou Bay Bridge will become the world's longest trans-oceanic bridge.
sentences.chinese: 中国的杭州湾大桥将成为世界上最长的跨海大桥。

sentences.english: Shanghai is located in the East China Sea coast, bounded by the Yangtze River estuary, south of Hangzhou Bay.
sentences.chinese: 上海位于中国东海海岸，北临长江口，南靠杭州湾。

sentences.english: Fengxian District, north shore of Hangzhou Bay, is building a modern coastal city.
sentences.chinese: 奉贤区正在建设一个杭州湾北岸的现代化滨海新城。

sentences.english: It has only 23 km to Hangzhou Bay Cross-Sea Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 基地距杭州湾跨海大桥只有23公里。

sentences.english: Donghai bridge situates at the Northeast of Hangzhou bay—the West of Zhoushan islands.
sentences.chinese: 东海大桥位于杭州湾口东北部，舟山群岛西侧。

sentences.english: The north of Hangzhou Bay has experienced the processes from retreat to siltation .
sentences.chinese: 杭州湾北岸经历了先侵蚀后淤涨的历史过程。

definition: the Yongjiang river through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]
Zhoushan prefecture level city in Zhejiang (consisting solely of islands)/formerly Dinghai 定海
Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]
Yangtze River Delta/abbr. for 長江三角洲|长江三角洲
Zhapu town and port on north of Hangzhou Bay 杭州灣|杭州湾 in Zhejiang

Binhai (place name)/Binhai New District, subprovincial district of Tianjin/Binhai county in Yancheng 鹽城|盐城[Yan2 cheng2], Jiangsu/fictitious city Binhai in political satire/Primorsky, a territory in the far east of Russia
Donghai Bridge, 32.5 km bridge between Shanghai and the offshore Yangshan deep-water port
Fenghua county level city in Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1], Zhejiang
Dianshan Lake between Shanghai Municipality and Jiangsu Province
